result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon P. Matke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Have mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.  If he has already had one, will have to sign a release for the agent to review the assessment.  If the agent is satisfied that it is relatively current, then he will not have to have another assessment.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No contact with minor child, A.J.
No unsupervised contact with any females under the agent of 18.

Obtain all prescriptions from a single pharmacy.
Have sex offender assessment and comply with recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

No contact with minor child A.J. 
No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Have sex offender assessment and comply with recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommend by the agent.

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Sentence After Revocation on 08-15-17

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court with attorney William George Weiland. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF93 and 14CF362.

10:03 a.m.  Atty Hess calls the case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Neither party has any deletions, additions or corrections to the Revocation Packet. 
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Atty Zell indicates that on 14CF362 this was an imposed/stayed sentence so no action will be taken on this case
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing

BY THE COURT:
14CF93:
Count 1 -
Prison sentence of 56 months
32 months of initial confinement
731 days of credit 
24 months of extended supervision 
**Comply with original conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Obtain all prescriptions from a single pharmacy.
Have mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.  If he has already had one, will have to sign a release for the agent to review the assessment.  If the agent is satisfied that it is relatively current, then he will not have to have another assessment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
No contact with minor child A.J. 
No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18.
Have sex offender assessment and comply with recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommend by the agent. 
Pay costs to include the DNA surcharge. 

14CF362:
Count 2 -
No action taken
Atty William Weiland appointed
(sent to DA/Weiland/kp)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 15, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF93, 14CF362
10:25 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI in 14CF93.  An agreement has been reached to resolve 14CF362. 
State files Victim Impact Statements (2).

14CF362 - 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST - Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CF362 Count 2 813.125(7).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF362 Count 1 is dismissed.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF93 -
Sentence withheld.  Placed on probation for a period of 3 years:
Serve 224 days in jail.  Credit for 224 days.  That condition is satisfied. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
obtain all prescriptions from a single pharmacy.
Have mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.  If he has already had one, will have to sign a release for the agent to review the assessment.  If the agent is satisfied that it is relatively current, then he will not have to have another assessment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
No contact with minor child A.J. 
No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18.
Have sex offender assessment and comply with recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommend by the agent. 
Pay costs to include the DNA surcharge. 

14CF362 -
Serve 270 days in jail, consecutive to conditional jail in 14CF93 - STAYED- 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years: 
Comply with all conditions in 14CF93. 
Have no contact with Jordann Politoski. 
Pay costs.
Sentencing hearing on December 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Atty Wallace

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: with Proposed Order
from Atty Sawyer re: PSI
dated 8/20 re: PSI
dated 8/8 re: Failure to participate in PSI
Sentencing hearing on December 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Court calls case at 10:39 a.m. Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court with attorney Stephen Walter Sawyer. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have not received the PSI report. Court questions Atty Sawyer.  Atty Sawyer clarifies the reason for not being ready.  ADA Knaapen states the victim and family are ready to proceed. Atty Sawyer makes statements and has some credibility possible issues of the victim as well.
Court admonishes both the Defendant and the victim in this case.  No further games.  The Court will not tolerate such things.

BTC:  Both the Defendant and the Victim are not to have contact with each other.  Neither is to contact the other.  If Defendant does so, Court will revoke his bond.  If Victim does so, Court to order penalties or sanction on her. 
Matter is rescheduled to allow the PSI to be completed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Johnathon P. Matke
Current: 801 Pulaski Place, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 07-02-2014)
Prior: 1801 Tamarack, Plover, WI 54467
Sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Amended from $5,000 cash bond to $5,000 signature bond with the same non-monetary conditions. 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to drugs and alcohol. Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   A.I.J. with a DOB 07/21/2000 and no unsupervised contact with minor females.

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court with attorney Stephen W Sawyer. Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in custody. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Amended Information. 
Clerk notes for the Court that 948.02(3)(b) is not recognizable in CCAP. 
Atty Sawyer indicates it is 948.03(2)(b).  
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Parties would like to proceed to sentencing at this time. Without a PSI. 
Court notes he is reluctant to go thru without a PSI.  Questions if that will interfere with the plea agreement. 
Atty Isherwood indicates if the Court would go thru with a PSI, asks that they address bond today. 
Atty Sawyer will recommend a signature bond with conditions. 
Atty Sawyer has received a copy of the Amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court orders a PSI. 

Atty Isherwood makes statements re: bond.  Believes the conditions of bond as set are appropriate.  Joint recommendation to signature bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica F Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Stephen W Sawyer in court for Defendant Johnathon P. Matke.

Matter is set for a motion for bond modification.

2:48 PM Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.

This was scheduled April 16th but Atty Sawyer was not present.
Atty Sawyer addresses the Court, there was a family emergency.
Court reviews the file and bond history.

Atty Sawyer addresses the Court regarding bond modification. Defendant or his family are not able to post the $5,000 cash. If released Defendant may start a job almost immediately, 3rd shift sanitation job. Defendant would be able to live with his brothers in Wausau.  Family would be able to post $500 cash and Defendant may sign a wage assignment.  Defendant's step-mom is present in the courtroom. Atty Sawyer addresses previous cases. 

Court questions Atty Sawyer for clarification regarding employment and residence address.
Atty Sawyer replies.

Atty Isherwood addresses the Court, opposes the reduction of the bond. State addresses letters written regarding a relationship.
State is concerned about the revoked probation due to this offense. Defendant wrote 3 letters to the victim from the jail. Defendant has an extensive juvenile record.
Atty Isherwood states Defendant does not have a good criminal record and this is a serious offense. The three letters were written before the bond was set but after Defendant entered the jail.

Atty Sawyer does not have copies of the letters, cannot verify the content. 

Court reviews the facts of the case.
Defendant faces substantial incarceration.
Court has some concern about the letter writing allegation.

Court feels the bond is appropriate and Defendant may be a flight risk.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the motion.

Parties address further scheduling.

Bond is ordered continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing 4/16/14 Attempted Not Known - Unable to Forward

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court, in custody. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:47 pm. Court calls case.
ADA Isherwood states appearances.
Atty Sawyer not present.
Defendant has not heard from Atty Sawyer since Monday 4-14-14.
Atty Isherwood questions if Atty Sawyer had filed a Motion.
Court reviews file.
No written Motion has been filed.
Court states he will be available today in the afternoon for a hearing.
Motion hearing on April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court with attorney Stephen Walter Sawyer. Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:55 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.
2:58 p.m. Atty Isherwood has not taken over case.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Atty Sawyer states that he had previously gone through the waiver information.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

Atty Sawyer provides the ADA and Court with a Discovery Demand.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court, in custody. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty for the Defendant is not present.  Notice states 1:30 p.m. instead of 3:00 p.m.  Defendant has a SAR hearing in Br 1 today at 2:30 p.m.  Court gives the file to branch 1 to be dealt with.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Atty S. Sawyer
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Walter Sawyer in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Atty will not waive the time limits.  Reserves the right to address bail. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   A.I.J. with a DOB 07/21/2000 and no unsupervised contact with minor females.

Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court, in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:42 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant has received a copy of the complaint.
Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.  
Defendant wishes to have complaint read.
Atty Cousins reads complaint.

Atty Cousins addresses the bond, requests $10,000 cash bond with conditions.

Defendant requests signature bond, had his first child in January and would like to support his child.

Matter will be adjourned one week for Defendant to seek counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
